Title: Crispy Rice Salad

Crispy Rice: 2 cups white raw rice, cooked and cooled
1 heaping tbsp chili paste (e.g., Sambal Oelek)
Salad: 1/2 cup chopped peanuts (or toasted sesame seeds if nut allergies)

Instructions: Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, mix the cooked white rice, chili paste, and oil until well combined.
Spread the rice mixture evenly on the baking sheet and bake for about 40 minutes, tossing every 10 minutes to ensure even crispness. Remove from the oven when crispy and golden. Let cool.
Chop the Persian cucumbers, fresh mint, fresh cilantro, and scallions, then place in a large bowl. Add the shelled edamame and diced avocado.
In a small bowl, prepare the dressing by whisking together soy sauce, seasoned rice vinegar, oil, brown sugar, lime juice, and minced garlic until well mixed.
Assemble the salad by adding the chopped peanuts and the cooled crispy rice to the bowl with the vegetables.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss well to combine.
Serve immediately or assemble just before serving to retain the texture of the crispy rice and avocado. Enjoy!
